name: NUKE CULT/DIRTY WORK november tour '13 tape
description: Nuke Cult Dirty Work Way, way back in November of 2013 (long ass time ago) these two daredevil maniac groups toured the whole entire United States of America in under a month. Okay, maybe they didn't tour the whole great country but they definitely went a lot of great places including Canada. Punk rockers bought out all of their tour tapes so if you didn't get one, ouch. ...BUT NOW you have the opportunity to get these 2 Kansas City bands on one damn tape. The original covers and inserts come with too so you can still be involved in the action! ((1st round - 100 clear NC/50 grey DW)) ((2nd round - 50 random NC&DW)) T R A C K S DW: Mama Mad Pity Fight Song Mattress Stains NC: Circle A Phantom Creep Ugly Music Brick Dreams Mental Defective

name: My Kind of Town VHS zine
description:
Some dude named Jake made this VHS zine. All the shows were filmed in Philly and each band has 2 songs each. Quality is okay, I guess they were dubbed over old movies. Pretty good idea this dude has. Features DIRTY WORK, SELF LOATHING, ALTERED BOYS, KREMLIN, GA$H, BAD ENERGY, and BRAIN SLUG.

*NOTE* Volume II is out now! Check it out, it looks really sweet. Also I don't think there are many more copies of this, so why not get it here. He he he.

name: TWERPS bloodspit boys 7"
description: Twerps TWERPS are back with their sick melodic take on hardcore punk. If you enjoyed their first 7", I would imagine you'd love this. Definitely a little heavier but the attitude and riffs ride on. ((100 translucent blue/200 black)) T R A C K S Bloodspit Boys Amherst Girls Twerp Jerk

name: DIRTY WORK s/t 7"
description: Dirty Work Coming at you is the debut 7” from Kansas City’s DIRTY WORK, who put out a hell of a demo tape over the summer. There is no gimmick about them, no dressing up like rockstars, or whaling on the guitar endlessly; straight USHC with misbehavior being the most driving factor for them. After listening to the recordings over and over again, the killer simplicity of NEOS came to mind. This is definitely not meant for adult ears! ((500 black/100 on tie-dye covers)) T R A C K S Walking Anxiety Get By Gun In My Mouth Shit-Eating Grin Bloody Concrete Dirty Air

name: NANCY demo tape
description: Nancy Here's eight super amazing bangers by NY's NANCY. These are a few dudes who have great taste in music and it shows through this tape. This tape is, should we say...perfect? If catchy isn't the word, I don't know what is because these lyrics and tunes will be on repeat in your head all day. Lets simply say there is some influence from THE JABBERS here. If I didn't know they were from here and now, I'd believe this was a re-issue of some old '77 group. It can't be stressed enough, G E T T H IS. ((1st round - 200 red/2nd round - 200 green)) T R A C K S I Want One Malt Licker Long Island Lovin Midnite Winners I Want You Bad Holiday Babes On Blades

name: BOX HUNDREDS demo tape
description: Box Hundreds This is a little off radar compared to the rest of our releases, but that don't mean shit. BOX HUNDREDS from Albany, NY play a style of music highly influenced by shoegaze. They kind of remind me of WEED HOUNDS, but longer songs and cool freakouts. Even though this is a demo, the recordings are solid. Make this the new soundtrack to your next zine making project or trip out with your lover. ((100 white)) T R A C K S Island of The Mind I Am The Road Heaven Bound Saturday Do

name: MAMMOTH TORTA s/t 7"
description: Mammoth Torta This 7" has been sadly neglected since it's release, about 4 years now. It came out on our old record label, Frankenjew Records, and didn't really sell...we also didn't know what we were doing and still don't. Despite the awful cover art, these 4 surf rock instrumental songs rule hard. Don't believe us? Check it out. This record is only a $1 because it won't sell otherwise, the band is no longer active, and we want people to hear this sick slab of wax. ((200 mixed orange/100 mixed dark grey)) T R A C K S Throwin' Heat Torta Recall Glass Axe Pacific Thrash Vortex

name: HALLOWEEN 2011 mixtape
description: In the spirit of Halloween, I decided to make some more of last year's mixtape. It has the same tape insert, music, and classic soundclips. If you think groups like CLEANERS FROM VENUS, B.F.G., THE SNAKE CORPS, IN THE NURSERY, and PHAIDIA will be your thing, get this! ((62min/18 tracks))

name: LOVE STILL BITES mixtape
description: Valentine's Day is coming up! For those of you too cheap to take your special someone out to dinner, here's a mixtape you can both enjoy and puke on each other to. Hum along to the two great Aussie punk bands THE SCIENTISTS and THE SAINTS; slam into each other with THE ABSENTEES and DOGGY STYLE; you get it right?! ((62min/25 tracks))

name: SUCKED DRY s/t 7"
description: Sucked Dry Pass Judgement The first track Arachnophobia hits hard as an opener, it truly sets the mood for what you'll be hearing on the rest of the 7". While they have been compared to CROSSED OUT, don't let just that decide for you. The lyrics are pretty personal so when you hear the vocals, it really draws the listener in. This is not the bomb going off, it's the soundtrack to the person planning it! ((1st Press - 500/black/2nd Press - 300/clear yellow)) T R A C K S Arachnophobia Lost Dog Fever Dreams Placebo Stockholm Syndrome

name: DIPERS shit house 7"
description: Dipers After 4 fantastic tape releases and countless (off the hook) shows, DIPERS are here with Shit House. Here we've got 7 brief but well written songs with topics ranging from dogs moshing, shitty bodegas, and XL fans. If your sense of humor sucks, don't let the lyrics bug you because the music is very unique in a world of punk. Other than TOM GREEN being an influence lyrically, I have never seen their riffs as being a rip of anything. All of the riffs in The Bomb remind me of something DESCENDENTS would do in their earlier albums. This is what's up. ((100 translucent blue/200 black)) tracks Fuck Technology Dog Mosh Shmegma Shong Fattest Fan Courtesy Flush Bodega Justice The Bomb

name: POOR CHOICE teenage love is beautiful 7"
description: Poor Choice Finally the 7" is done! These recordings are definitely "darker" than earlier POOR CHOICE stuff. It's more raw and d-beat like but still has a punk beat to it. Everything is fuzzy and loud, including the vocals. Every song but the last one is under a minute long. The final song is about 2 classmates falling in love; dig that! ((100 clear w/ tie-dye cover/200 black)) tracks Nothing Better To Do Trash Your Shows Everything Is Fine City Rat Get Past The Wreck Punching Out Forever Food Choice Kostner House D&D Teenage Love Is Beautiful
